Title: Locking in CockroachDB, Part 3 - Killing Sessions and Transactions | no dogma blog

Title: Lottery economics -Louis-Andr√© Labadie
Description: Where I live, the national loto company, Loto-Qu√©bec, regularly run campaigns reminding players to sign their tickets or scratch cards when they play. Ostensibly, this protects the winner ‚Äì in some minimal way ‚Äì but the back of every ticket is also a contract with Loto Qu√©bec. That contract states that, essentially, a winner is not entitled to receive their prize unless they allow Loto Qu√©bec to run news and ads featuring them.

Title: Development gets better with Age
Description:
He has heard the whispers, ‚Äúhe is getting older, who will replace him?‚Äù People asking him with a straight face, ‚Äúwhen will you retire?‚Äù After close to 25 years at Amazon, where each year has been different and amazing, He feels as young as the day he decided to leave academia and join Amazon.
The thing about getting older as a developer, is that you have seen a lot and encountered many of the problems younger developers are facing (even if they look a little different on first glance). If you‚Äôve been around the block as many times as some of us have, you‚Äôll have earned battle scars along the way. There are days in war rooms you will never forget. You have experimented a lot, and you have failed more times than you care to remember. You have half-a-head full of what is practical and works. And a quarter of that space has been trained to look for red flags, scanning for things that you know will go wrong.

Title: Make it so: GenAI, OpenAPI and ZAP
Description:
Have you ever wondered how hard it is to make an AI talk to an API? Wouldn‚Äôt it be great if I could talk to a machine like Captain Picard does to his computer?
‚ÄúTea. Earl Grey. Hot!‚Äù would have to sent to the replicator subsystem with the correct instructions. But how would that actually work? I suppose, the Starship Enterprise-D made its first appearance on the airwaves in 1987. So at the time I guess we could expect a replicator to be programmed in C.

Title: Mapgen4 renderer

I had been leaving all feature updates for a future map generator.

Title: Big Tech Told Kids to Code. The Jobs Didn‚Äôt Follow.
Description:
For the past decade, a simple message has been delivered to a generation of American students: If you learn to code and complete a computer science degree, you‚Äôll get a job with a six-figure salary.


Now, thousands of students who followed the advice are discovering that the promise was empty. Natasha Singer, a technology reporter for The Times, explains.


Guest: Natasha Singer (https://www.nytimes.com/by/natasha-singer) , a technology reporter in the business section of The New York Times.


Background reading:¬†

  ‚Ä¢  Goodbye, $165,000 tech jobs. Student coders seek work at Chipotle (https://www.nytimes.com/2025/08/10/technology/coding-ai-jobs-students.html) .

For more information on today‚Äôs episode, visit¬†nytimes.com/thedaily (http://nytimes.com/thedaily?smid=pc-thedaily) . Transcripts of each episode will be made available by the next workday.¬†
